xml.description: # Introduction ## Loops which include variables The loop in this example is different from the repeat 10 times loop. It includes a variable which you can rename to any convenient word or letter. The value stored inside this variable(i) is a number which increases from 1 to 10 in steps of 1. Which means that the first time the loop is run, i=1 , the next time it is 2 .. and so on. We are printing a multiplication table for 5, so we create text which reads ` five x ` and join it with the variable i. The actual text created will then be `five x 1` , `five x 2` and so on since the value of i keeps changing. For the right hand side of the equation, we use the math blocks to calculate i multiplied by the number 5 and add it to the previously created text. All the text strings are created only for readability, and are not necessary. You can simply print i*5 like so.. and get results without any pretty formatted text before it ## Execute the code + Click on the `Run` button to view the results + Change 10 to 20 and check that loop works correctly
